blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol
blog.description:
Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

blog.name: luckthebard
blog.title: Luck the Bard
blog.description: 30s, Queer (Lesbian), I love D&D; My brother got me hooked on Critical Role. I try but don't always tag spoilers so this account is not #spoilerfree

summary: I know it’s just because Matt forgot Fumpkin was an owl, but I love the idea that that one pirate guard had never seen a cat...
body: I know it’s just because Matt forgot Fumpkin was an owl, but I love the idea that that one pirate guard had never seen a cat before, and so just went with Caleb’s declaration that this bird was a “cat,” delighted to have finally seen one.

reblog.comment: I know it’s just because Matt forgot Fumpkin was an owl, but I love the idea that that one pirate guard had never seen a cat before, and so just went with Caleb’s declaration that this bird was a “cat,” delighted to have finally seen one.

trail.content_raw: I know it’s just because Matt forgot Fumpkin was an owl, but I love the idea that that one pirate guard had never seen a cat before, and so just went with Caleb’s declaration that this bird was a “cat,” delighted to have finally seen one.

tags: i'm not sure they've ever had a more Peak D&D Arc
summary: So, hey, this arc’s been Something. Go to talk to a dude on the docks.  Blow up the dock, kill a crew, steal a ship....
body:
So, hey, this arc’s been Something.

  • Go to talk to a dude on the docks.
  • Blow up the dock, kill a crew, steal a ship. Entirely—and genuinely—by accident.
  • Come back to the same place to hire a new crew and somehow avoid getting arrested.
  • Sail out to sea and meet a terrifying pirate captain who also happens to be a cultist of a creepy sea monster.
  • Wind up sort of stuck working with her because the alternative is probably a horrible, horrible death. But hey. Learn more about the creepy sea monster. That’s cool.
  • Engage in a little light piracy.
  • Okay, now said pirate captain can magically manipulate water.
  • Sail to a pirate island and get initiated into a Super Shifty Pirate Club by a really creepy dude who straight-up wears someone else’s scalp.
  • Decide to sneak back onto the cultist’s ship to find out what she’s hiding.
  • Find a journal she keeps.
  • Retrieve said journal super sneakily and not leaving a single trace behind, except for the giant hole in the floor, the dude who got stabbed by his friend in the confusion, and the other dude who jumped off the crow’s nest to escape an invisible fire and broke his leg.
  • Oh shit, the journal’s in code.
  • Oh shit, on a complete fluke of a die roll, break the journal’s code and manipulate its contents a bit to suggest less of a plot to awaken creepy sea monsters and more of a plot to overthrow Scalp Dude.
  • Morning comes around? Cultist is furious and calls everyone back to the ship to find out what’s going on. Panic, throw some gems in the ocean, and just straight-up bring the journal on board.
  • Cultist has someone on board who can find items magically. Sees the journal is just sitting there in a pocket.
  • Light the ship on fire, summon a demon, do a bunch of teleporting, and eventually get everyone off the ship in one piece… and deliver the journal into the guards’ hands.
  • Manipulate Scalp Dude into reading about the cultist’s plans to super duper overthrow him.
  • Manipulate the situation so the cultist is magically compelled to tell the truth at all times and can’t say anything or nothing without incriminating herself.
  • Scalp Dude kills the cultist, does a little light banishment of all survivors.
  • Take the cultist’s ship and a Very Confused Crew and sail away.

tags: just theorizing. throwing some thoughts around. wondering about things....
title: what we know about Dashilla
body:
tl;dr: Dashilla is some sort of cursed/eldritch entity, probably connected to Uk’otoa, likely with anglerfish illusion powers. We don’t know very much else.

“Where once the waters rolled calmly by,
where ocean’s heart did sing,
There stalks a lass with a hungry eye
and claws that grasp and wring.
With lantern lure of a glimmer pot,
with treasure in their eyes,
Below they swam to the gold they thought
would await them as their prize.
Yet each of them went to surely die,
their graves to not be found,
For Dashilla and her hungry eye
collects the lost and drowned.” (x)

Let’s take this line by line:

“Where once the waters rolled calmly by” – The waters around Dashilla’s lair used to be calm, but possibly no longer are (or this shanty is just set in the past). This might be marked by the storm that started brewing just as the Mighty Nein were about to dive.

“Where ocean’s heart did sing” –  hey, we’ve already seen whales! Which, I’d argue, would be decent candidates for the “ocean’s heart” singing. Still, it’s kinda interesting that the whales aren’t scared of the area. Maybe Dashilla just doesn’t hunt them? That makes me think she’s more after souls than blood.

“There stalks a lass with a hungry eye” – could be related to Uk’otoa (one eye). It’s probably intended to be singular, since it comes up later… okay, it’s definitely related to Uk’otoa. But I’m not sure it’s as clear-cut as that.

“And claws that grasp and wring” – Okay, this is fairly obvious, but there’s one key point: Dashilla isn’t human. At least, not anymore.

“With lantern lure of a glimmer pot, with treasure in their eyes, below they swam to the gold they thought would await them as their prize” – This is making me think of illusions, anglerfish style, since it’s strongly implied that there actually isn’t any treasure. Wave a shiny thing around and then eat the trespassers.

“Yet each of them went to surely die, their graves to not be found” – Even the information in this shanty isn’t necessarily accurate, given that everyone who’s seen Dashilla has died. (I’m assuming.)

“For Dashilla and her hungry eye collects the lost and drowned” – Singular eye again. “Collects” is interesting– implies she maybe keeps something or is targeting divers to get something in particular. Also, “hungry”. A clear tie to Uk’otoa, but also, implies she’s going after whoever comes down, not just eating people who wander into her mouth.

Obviously, this leaves a lot out. What exactly is Dashilla? What are her powers? Is she cursed, or was she always this weird eldritch entity? Is she protecting something, or is she looking for something? Fjord’s ship is there, but the Diver’s Grave was known as a landmark before that, so what exactly is it? And why was Fjord’s ship sunk there, of all places?

((For what it’s worth, here’s my theory:

  • Dashilla is a former champion of Uk’otoa, cursed when Uk’otoa was banished, now trying to collect/protect the orbs and taking divers as sacrifices to Uk’otoa.
  • She has illusion/mind manipulation powers and did something to Sabien to make him sink the ship where he did, because she could sense Vandren’s presence onboard.
  • If anyone sees the orb down there, it will almost definitely be an illusion.
  • Dashilla knows Fjord is coming and she’s not going to let him go without a fight.))

((For what it’s worth, here’s my theory:

  • Dashilla is a former champion of Uk’otoa, cursed when Uk’otoa was banished, now trying to collect/protect the orbs and taking divers as sacrifices to Uk’otoa.
  • She has illusion/mind manipulation powers and did something to Sabien to make him sink the ship where he did, because she could sense Vandren’s presence onboard.
  • If anyone sees the orb down there, it will almost definitely be an illusion.
  • Dashilla knows Fjord is coming and she’s not going to let him go without a fight.))

Obviously, this leaves a lot out. What exactly is Dashilla? What are her powers? Is she cursed, or was she always this weird eldritch entity? Is she protecting something, or is she looking for something? Fjord’s ship is there, but the Diver’s Grave was known as a landmark before that, so what exactly is it? And why was Fjord’s ship sunk there, of all places?

((For what it’s worth, here’s my theory:

  • Dashilla is a former champion of Uk’otoa, cursed when Uk’otoa was banished, now trying to collect/protect the orbs and taking divers as sacrifices to Uk’otoa.
  • She has illusion/mind manipulation powers and did something to Sabien to make him sink the ship where he did, because she could sense Vandren’s presence onboard.
  • If anyone sees the orb down there, it will almost definitely be an illusion.
  • Dashilla knows Fjord is coming and she’s not going to let him go without a fight.))
trail.content_abstract:
tl;dr: Dashilla is some sort of cursed/eldritch entity, probably connected to Uk’otoa, likely with anglerfish illusion powers. We don’t know very much else.

“Where once the waters rolled calmly by,
where ocean’s heart did sing,
There stalks a lass with a hungry eye
and claws that grasp and wring.
With lantern lure of a glimmer pot,
with treasure in their eyes,
Below they swam to the gold they thought
would await them as their prize.
Yet each of them went to surely die,
their graves to not be found,
For Dashilla and her hungry eye
collects the lost and drowned.” (x)

Let’s take this line by line:

tags: posting for those who wanted something easy to reblog
title: Fundraising for a Service Dog
body:
Hello! I am a fanficcer, Critter, small streamer, and all sorts of other things. I am also currently on disability for severe mental health issues (trigger warning for discussion of depression and thoughts of suicide).

I would very much like to get back to work and life again. Among my various treatments, my doctors have recommended I partner with a psychiatric service dog. The cost of training a service dog is high but would be invaluable to me in letting me live my life again.

I know I am not the only person going through a difficult time right now. However, if you would like to and are able to help, I have set up a GoFundMe for donations. Any amount is helpful and appreciated, as is sharing and signal boosting.

Thank you!

blog.name: criticalfic
blog.title: Critical Role fic recs
blog.description: A Critical Role fic rec blog. Submissions/requests/suggestions very welcome as I get this up and running!

title: Strictly Ballroom
body:
Strictly Ballroom by wilderswans (15,939 words)

Set in an AU from early Campaign 1. Molly and Caleb have to go undercover at a fancy ball to make sure the lord the rest of the M9 are stealing from doesn’t come home and catch them. This is, of course, an excuse for Molly and Caleb to get all dressed up and have several tense moments and try not to flirt with each other in the grand tradition of any fake-dating adjacent fic. It’s SO GOOD, hits many tropes, the descriptions are appropriately lavish for the kind of ball they’re attending, there’s some great Messages from Jester, and a surprise appearance by a certain character that I may have screamed out loud about.

reblog.comment:
